question: ‘Mass migration of blue earthworms’ was recently observed in which Indian state?
explanation:
Every year, a group of blue earthworms, migrate about 300 metres up and down the slopes in the East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya.
Scientists of the Zoological Survey of India (ZSI) have prepared a report on the two-way mass migration, for the first time. The blue earthworms migrate twice annually, uphill in spring and downhill in autumn.
